sentences.english: In particular, the technology sector grew like crazy.
But there is potential—albeit uncertain—for gold to go much higher.
sentences.chinese: 但金价是有潜力大幅上扬的，尽管涨势并不确定。

sentences.english: But we are finally seeing some signs of weakness.
sentences.chinese: 但我们终于看到金价涨势疲软的一些迹象。

sentences.english: After opening higher, US stocks extended that rally.
sentences.chinese: 在开高后，美国股市延续了涨势。

sentences.english: The high beta Australian and New Zealand dollars rose on the back of gains in the equity markets.
sentences.chinese: 澳元和纽元这两个风险货币受股市涨势的推高。

sentences.english: Polyester staple fiber rally to last, could return $?
sentences.chinese: 涤纶短纤涨势是否能够延续，能否重返万元之上？

definition: to fall back (of water level or share prices)
(of sales, prices etc) to fall/to drop/decline/slump
bull market (prices appear to be rising)
market price/quotation of market price/the current market situation
to fall back/to return to low level after a rise (in water level, price etc)
to bounce/to bounce back/to boomerang/to ricochet/rebound (of stock market etc)/bounce/backlash/negative repercussions
extent of a rise (in prices etc)/amount of increase/growth (typically expressed as a percentage)
to regurgitate/(fig.) (of a stock market) to give up (gains)
to continue to fall (of share prices)
